intro: Spermacoce trichosiphonia, commonly known as the African star apple, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pink flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by berry-like fruits containing several seeds. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
